intro: Clusia wurdackiana, commonly known as the waxleaf clusia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy, dark green leaves that are often glossy and leathery in texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are typically followed by yellowish-orange berries. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage. Clusia wurdackiana is relatively low-maintenance and tolerant of various soil types, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor gardening.
